description: Taiwan CECC determines that all primary and secondary schools will postpone the first day of spring semester until 2 weeks later to minimize the risk of the spread of the disease and ensure students’ health on Feb. 02.

description: Taiwan CDC has raised the travel notice level for Wuhan City to Level 2: Alert, advising travelers planning to recently visit Wuhan and other neighboring areas in China to take personal precautions to ward off infection on Jan. 16.

description: Taiwan CECC broadens the travel notice to Hubei Province (including Wuhan City) and raised the level for Hubei Province to Level 3: Warning on Jan 25. The public is advised to avoid non-essential trips to the area.

description: Taiwan CECC stipulates restrictions on entry of Chinese citizens on Jan. 26.

description: On March 11 Taiwan CECC raises travel notice to Level 1: Watch for the following countries: the Czech Republic, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Hungary, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Ireland and the United Kingdom; visitors to the countries listed above to take usual precautionary measures.

description: Taiwan CECC raises the travel notice on March 17, to Level 3: Warning, for all Schengen countries, Ireland and UK. People are advised to avoid nonessential travel to these countries. The CECC raised its travel notice for the states of Washington, New York and California to level 2: Alert. Travelers visiting these regions are advised to practice enhanced precautions. The travel notice for remaining US states is Level 1: Watch, and visitors are advised to take usual precautionary measures.

description: On March 16 the Taiwan CECC raises travel notice for 42 countries and one territory in Eastern Europe, Middle East, Central Asia, and Northern Africa to Level 3: Warning; The CECC advises against all nonessential travel.

enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: Taiwan CECC raises travel notice for the US, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand, including transit flights, to Level 3: Warning; advises against all nonessential travel to these countries on March 18.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Taiwan CECC announces that starting from March 19, entry of all foreign nationals will not be allowed unless documents of granted entry are provided on March 18.

description: On March 17, Taiwan's CECC raises travel notice for 20 Asian, East European countries, and three US states to Level 3: Warning effective from March 19; advises against all nonessential travel.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: On March 20 the Taiwan CECC has announced that in addition to the countries already at Level 3: Warning on the travel notice list, the travel notice for all countries will now be raised to Level 3: Warning, effective 00:00 Taipei Standard Time (GMT+8) on March 21. Citizens should avoid any nonessential travel abroad
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: Taiwan CECC announces that it will suspend the transit of airline passengers through Taiwan from 00:00 Taipei Standard Time (GMT+8) on March 24 (Tuesday) until April 7, to decrease the cross-border movement of people and to reduce the risk of disease transmission on March 22. On April 01 the ban has been extended to 24:00 Taipei Standard Time (GMT+8) April 30.
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: Taiwan CECC announces on 23 April that it will extend restrictions on direct cross-strait flights and the ban on airline traveler transits through Taiwan. The restrictions are originally scheduled to be lifted April 29 and April 30. The CECC stated that when to lift the restrictions remains to be decided depending on the developments of the COVID-19 pandemic.
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: Taiwan CDC monitors all individuals who had traveled to Wuhan within 14 days and exhibited a or symptoms of upper respiratory tract infections on Jan. 5.

description: On Jan. 23 Taiwan Ministry of Economic Affairs imposes a ban on face masks of textile materials exports for a month from Jan 24 to Feb. 23. The ban was extend to April 30 on Feb. 13.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Taiwan Ministry of Economic Affairs (MOEA) has issued a requisition for  companies that have medical equipment licenses and factory registration certificates on Jan. 31. For the remaining 37 mask manufacturers who have production facts but are relatively small, the Ministry of Health and Welfare (MOHW) has also issued the fourth batch of mask requisitions. The mask production of 66 companies with production facts has been fully requisitioned on Feb 13.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: In response to the pneumonia epidemic in Wuhan, on January 31 the Taiwan Executive Yuan announces “general medical masks and surgical masks” as “essential necessities” in order to strengthen the control of epidemic prevention materials. If the price is hoarded, the maximum penalty is three years ’imprisonment according to the Criminal Law of the Republic of China (Taiwan).
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: Taiwan CDC announces that In response to the development of the epidemic, medical personnel will be restricted from going abroad on Feb. 23. The target of the restriction will be mainly medical personnel directly related to the care of patients in the hospital.
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: Taiwan CDC announces that In response to the development of the epidemic, medical personnel will be restricted from going abroad on Feb. 23. The target of the restriction will be mainly medical personnel directly related to the care of patients in the hospital.

description: Taiwan Customs Administration, Ministry of Finance, imposes export control on thermometers from 3/04 - 3/31 on March 4. Travelers are allowed to carry (up to 2 per person) thermometers out of the country.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Police

description: On March 2, Taiwan CECC announces that starting March 5, everyone to be allowed for one additional face mask every week due to increased production. Adults will be eligible for three face masks and children will be allowed for five masks every seven days, under name-based system.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: Taiwan CECC announces on March 10 that an online ordering mechanism will be added to the name-based rationing system for face masks on March 12. The mechanism will allow people to order at a designated website using their NHI card or Citizen Digital Certificate or through the NHI app other than pharmacies.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: on March 12 Taiwan CECC establishes a community specimen surveillance program and protocols of different levels of care for patients. It establishes 167 designated community inspection institutes for suspected cases; a total of 50 hospitals were designated for serious treatment of suspected covid19 infection. The updated numbers on April 08 are 163 designated community inspection institutes  and 52 hospitals.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Taiwan donated 1 million surgical masks and caps to the Health Ministry on Friday to combat the health emergency.

description: On March 20 Taiwan CECC announces that duty free stores at five designated airports in Taiwan will begin to sell requisitioned face masks to inbound travelers on March 21. A unit of face masks costs NT$50, or US$2, and each person is allowed to buy only one unit (three adult face masks or five child-size face masks).
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Taiwan CECC announces on March 23 that the second round of online ordering under the name-based rationing system for face masks will commence on March 25.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: Ministry of Economic Affairs announces on Jan. 31 that the government will invest 200 million NTD to purchase mask machineries and equipments. It is expected to increase the production capacity of masks to 10 million per day. Since April 08 the mask production has reached 15 million per day, and is expected to reach 17 million by the end of April.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: On April 01 Taiwan CECC, together with Tourism Bureau, launch the "anti-epidemic with reassurance (安心防疫)" hotel program and formulate subsidy measures for epidemic prevention hotels in order to hotel business to join.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: On April 01 the Taiwan's Ministry of Foreign Affairs announces that it will carry out the first wave of international humanitarian assistance and donate 10 million masks to the United States, the European Union and European countries with severe epidemics, as well as Taiwan's diplomatic allies.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
target_region: Europe,European Union (without the UK),Other Regions (please specify below)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Zimbabwe, traditional herbalists have been authorised by the national government to treat coronavirus patients, as of April 1st. Patients can choose to consult traditional healers and consent to treatment, if they wish.
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: Taiwan CECC announces on April 03 that passengers are required to wear masks when taking metro. Those who don't follow the advice will face up to 15,000 NTD fine.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: Taiwan CECC announces that passengers are officially required to wear masks when taking taxi (including Uber) on April 05. Drivers can refuse to take passengers who are not wearing masks.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: Taiwan CECC announces that it continues to keep track of available beds for severe cases of COVID-19 on April 07. Up till April 03 the number of negative pressure isolation beds is 970 with 417 available; the number of ordinary isolation beds is 958 with 548 available; the special wards have a total of 1,711 hospital beds with 1,177 beds available. The designated hospital of the medical network a total of 20,985 beds available. There are 9,932 respirator units with 1,300 units available.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: On March 07 Taiwan CECC announces that it continues to requisition facilities (dormitories, training centers, camps, etc.) to increase the number of designated sites for group quarantine; a total of 13 centralized quarantine places have been established with a total of 1,553 rooms.

description: On April 08 the Taiwan CECC announces that it will continue to expanding test capacity: A national testing network (with 34 testing facilities) has been established to improve Taiwan’s testing capacity. The strategy allows the maximum testing capacity per day to reach 3,800 specimen tests, and COVID-19 testing to be conducted in different areas to reduce wait time for test results.

enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: On April 09 the Taiwan MOFA announces the second wave of international humanitarian aid operations and Taiwan will donate 6 million masks to countries severely affected by the epidemic, including EU member states in Northern Europe and Central and Eastern Europe, the heavily damaged states in the United States, countries in Latin America and the Caribbean, the New Southbound policy target countries (south east asian countries).

description: On April 14 the Taiwan CDC launches the fifth term of online masks purchase. Masks will be available for pre-orders starting from April 15th. In addition to the original adult masks, 3D masks for children aged 4-8 can be purchased online as well.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: On April 17, considering many people are purchasing masks through eMask system, the Taiwan CECC announces that masks will not be distributed at pharmacies and local public health centers every Sunday from April 19, to allow the personnel to have time off to rest.

description: Announced 20 May. President Lionel Aingimea, government ministers and health staff  gathered  in  the  RoN  hospital’s  acute  block  to  receive  generous contributions of personal protective equipment (PPE) and medical equipment, from Taiwan and Israel, 8 May.Republic of China (Taiwan) Ambassador Dean Wang presented Nauru  health  with  a  medical  supplies  package  valued  at  over  AU$220,000,  which  included  cutting  edge  technology  –  a Lightcycler 480 PCR COVID-19 testing machine and testing kits, a thermal imager with infrared camera plus two additional thermal imager cameras, infrared forehead thermometers, along with 40,000 medical facemasks and other PPE.Ambassador  Wang  also  announced  an  additional  AU$1.65 million  as  an  extra  budgetary  offer  for  purchasing  medical  supplies
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: in order to expedite the process of quarantine operations and immigration clearance upon arrival, Taiwan CDC has developed the Passenger Health Declaration and Home Quarantine Information System (Entry Quarantine System) and will launch the system soon. Travelers with mobile phone numbers provided by telecom operators in Taiwan can use the Entry Quarantine System by scanning the QR Code while waiting at the check-in counter

description: Under close coordination between the Taiwan CECC, the Environmental Protection Administration and the Ministry of Education, local environmental protection departments have been tasked with disinfecting public spaces surrounding schools and public kindergartens and spaces in light of the start (Feb. 25) of the new semester on Feb 19.

description: Taiwan CDC together with  Ministry of Transportation and Communications (MOTC) announce that public transportation ridership should be disinfected on Feb. 19. Carriages of the Taiwan High Speed Rail (THSR) and Taiwan Railways (TR) should be cleaned and disinfected at least once a day; points of frequent contact inside THSR carriages (e.g., armrests, tables) once each round trip; and points of frequent contact in metro carriages once every eight hours.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In order to strengthen the epidemic prevention of travelers that are subject to home quarantine while considering their transportation needs,  On March 02 the Taiwan MOTC launches the "Home Quarantine Airport Transportation Plan (居家檢疫者自機場返家交通方案)" that provides designated taxis and rental cars for travelers point-to-point transportation service on March 04.

description: under the guidance of the National Security Conference of the Presidential Office, the Homeland Security Office of the Executive Yuan and experts, the Taiwan CECC jointly develop the "Enterprises in Response to Serious Special Infections Guidelines for the Continuous Operation of Epidemic Pneumonia (COVID-19)" on March 05 to reduce the impact of the epidemic on the operation of the enterprise.

description: On March 18 the Taiwan Executive Yuan launches effective scientific and technological measures to assist in epidemic prevention operations, including the "entry quarantine system"  - to accelerate the entry data inspection and procedures electronically - which is combined with the back-end "electronic fence intelligent monitoring system"- to track whereabouts through mobile phone positioning to ensure Implementation of anti-epidemic measures.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: The Taiwan MOTC announces that starting from April 01 all major public transport stations (including railway stations, airports, metros, highway stations, post offices ) will take passengers' body temperature for 2 times before entering the stations. If the body temperature is over 37.5 (forehead) or 38 degrees (ear temperature), passengers will be asked to return home or seek medical treatment. This measure will be fully implemented starting from May 01.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Besides the LINE Bot system,"Disease Containment Expert," (developed jointly by the CECC, Line Taiwan and HTC Corporation’s healthcare unit) was officially launched for use on April 3 to track people in home quarantine. Taiwan CECC launches new function to the current SMS reporting mechanism, allowing those in home quarantine/isolation to report their health status via SMS. on April 08. These information will be integrated into the "epidemic prevention tracking system."
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: The Taiwan CECC releases the demonstration video for business sectors to make appropriate adjustments in light the coronavirus on April 21. The video includes information such as adjustments of the operation mode of production chains, contingency mechanism, etc. The purpose is to help enterprises survive the pandemic.

enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Taiwan Executive Yuan announces the new task force "the CDC Construction Plan"on April 12. The Plan aims to construct the National Health Command Center (NHCC) and labs in raising Taiwan's epidemic surveillance, inspection research, disease prevention and policy planning and other projects. The plan is expected to be implemented from 2021 and completed in 2027
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health

description: Since 2003, Taiwan has set up inbound passenger quarantine stations at airports in light of the SARS outbreak. The Infrared Thermometer is supplemented by an ear thermometer to conduct body temperature screening for all inbound passengers and has continued to operate to this day.

description: Taiwan CDC raises the travel notice level for Wuhan City to Level 1: Watch and advice travelers planning to visit Wuhan or other neighboring areas in China recently to avoid contact with wild animals and poultry, avoid visiting live poultry markets and consuming undercooked meats, and avoid contact with patients and wash hands thoroughly with soap on Jan, 07.

description: Taiwan CDC announces on Dec 31 2019 that according to Article 63 of the Law on the Prevention and Control of Infectious Diseases, anyone who spreads rumors or false information about the epidemic situation of infectious diseases will be fined up to NT $ 3 million; Additionally, article 63, paragraph 5 of the Law stipulates that anyone who spreads rumors to affect public tranquillity shall be detained for less than three days or fined under NT $ 30,000.

description: On Jan. 26 Taiwan CECC "urged people returning from Hubei Province to implement home quanrantine measures. description: On Feb. 01 Taiwan CECC categorizes different parts of China into two levels based on the severity of 2019-nCoV outbreak: Level 1 Area and Level 2 Area. Level 1 Area indicates areas with significant community transmission which is hard to control, and Hubei province has been listed as Level 1 Area. Taiwan CECC raises outbreak level for Guangdong province to Level 2. Travelers with history of travel to Guangdong required home quarantine for 14 days

description: Taiwan's CECC advises people who visited tourist sites in the Taipei Metropolitan Area on 31 Jan and had close contact with tourists for more than 15 mins in an indoor environment to self-monitor their health for 14 days, till 14 February, as they may have come into contact with infected travellers on the Diamond Princess cruise. description:
Taiwan's Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) advised the general public on April 1 as part of the first phase of its social distancing measures to keep a distance from others of at least 1.5 meters in indoor environments and 1 meter in outdoor ones. 

They note that if all people gathering in a certain place wear face masks in the proper manner, these social distancing recommendations may be ignored.

They further noted that in the second phase, which will commence if and when circumstances require, the CECC will institute mandatory rules. For essential activities such as medical care, official duties, and work, social distancing of 1.5 meters indoors and 1 meter outdoors must be observed. Even if people correctly wear face masks, a distance of at least 1 meter must be maintained.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force
